result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando C Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: To case 2014CF3025 and consecutive to 2013CF5134.
Extended supervision and probation conditions the same.
Probation review hearing in Br. 4 on 3-27-2015 at 1:30pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

No firearm; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

No violent contact with the victim, Gail D. or LA or any child.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children and supervised with LA (dob 11-19-09).

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health treatment and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drug. No alcohol.

for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Abuse.    
Upon the request of agent, Court imposed the following stayed condition time.  The Court finding that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 DAYS of the condition time that was previously stayed. Filed, signed Order For Commitment for Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.    mld

for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-Compliance with Probation Conditions - Domestic Abuse.    
Upon the request of agent, Court imposed the following stayed condition time.  The Court finding that the defendant has not been complying with the conditions of probation.  The Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 DAYS of the condition time that was previously stayed. Filed, signed Order For Commitment for Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions.   Upon the request of agent, Probation Review Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 3-27-2015 at 1:30 pm, is cancelled and removed from the court's calendar.   mld

Defendant Orlando C Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Orlando C Davis in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Gail D. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONCURRENT to case 2014CF3025) and CONSECUTIVE to 2013CF5134), with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 30 MONTHS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH. 
   (60 days is concurrent with case 2014CF3025).
   Release for work, school and treatment. 
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Treatment and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim, Gail D. or LA or any child.  
* Defendant may have contact with the victim
   through a third party to arrange time with 
   children and supervised with LA (dob 11-19-09)
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the 
   Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 3-27-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Court may consider expungment only if defendant has no violations of the law.   mld

INVOICE #
FORWARDED TO ACCOUNTS PAYABLE DEPARTMENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $156.25 to Dr. Collins for services on 09-16 & 09-18-14.
COPY IN FILE.

Defendant Orlando C Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #1, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  

Victim, Gail D., appeared and requested modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification.  Court maintains the current no contact order.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 11-10-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Orlando C Davis in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record conference held in chambers between the Court and counsel.  Doctor's Report, dated 9-18-2014, was read by the parties.  No challenges to the report by either the State or defense counsel.  Based upon the report of Dr. Collins, the Court found no basis for the NGI plea.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 10-29-2014 at 8:30 am.    

Victim, Gail D., (on case 2014CF939), appeared and requested modification of the no contact order.  Court denied modification of the no contact order.   mld

Defendant Orlando C Davis in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
   Case recalled.  Defense counsel informs the court, that upon going over the offer with defendant on the plea forms, that she believes that the defendant is not competent to proceed.   Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered defendant to be examined by Dr. Collins regarding the special plea (NGI) on 7-25-2014 at 9:00 am, Room 504 (Forensic Unit), Safety Building.  Report to be filed by 8-11-2014.  Court ordered case adjourned for return on the doctor's report to Branch 4 on 8-15-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail, including no guns, pepper spray taser or weapons, are continued until further order of the Court.    mld

Defendant Orlando C Davis in court with attorney Mary G Guimont.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Prior to case being called, the Court held a brief sidebar with counsel.  Defense counsel informed the Court that there has been a breakdown in communication between her and defendant.  Case passed to afternoon.   mld
